newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products firm, support from French strike.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products firm, support from French strike.

text.p: NWE oil products were firm on Tuesday, with some supported by concerns about the French oil workers' strike.
Naphtha ended modestly higher, helped by crude's recent gains and delays at Algeria's Skikda port.
Gasoline rose from the twin props of the arbitrage to the U.S. and the six-day-old Elf refinery workers' strike.
Fuel oil gained strength from crude and concerns over the Elf dispute. Cracked cargoes were up to $124 cif.
Gas oil firmed $3 a tonne with futures.
